Catchcold Tower was built in the early 1400s, and it was originally a gun emplacement.

On top, there’s a concrete reminder of a Second World War anti-aircraft gun. This was the last time Southampton's medieval walls were used for their intended purpose - to defend the town. https://t.co/QT6Rk2HI4c

One year after the tragedy in Las Vegas, Republicans still oppose commonsense gun laws that will help keep us safer. The shooter used legally purchased assault weapons and bump stocks to take 58 lives. Today, someone could still stockpile the same arsenal. We have to stop this.

One year ago 58 people were killed and 800 injured by a gunman in Las Vegas. My thoughts are with those victims' families today. We have got to prevent more innocent Americans from becoming victims of gun violence by passing commonsense gun safety legislation.
